intro: Nectris furcata, commonly known as the forked nectris, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive forked leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers that bloom in clusters. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats within its native range.
